p: To compute E 0, we used daily maximum and minimum air temperature ( tasmax and tasmin), relative humidity ( rhs), wind speed ( sfcWind), and upward and downward shortwave and longwave radiation ( rsus, rsds, rlus, and rlds) at the surface. To compute the drought risk indices, we used our daily estimates of E 0 and also the modelsâ€™ daily precipitation rate ( pr). The purpose of this paper is to illustrate how different methodologies can lead to very different projections of drought risk under climate change scenarios, therefore we restricted our analyses to two climate models. We do not extensively evaluate different plausible scenarios for future drought risk using several CMIP5 climate models, such as those done by Cook et al. [ 17] and Kumar et al. [ 46], for example.
